channel.title: My addictive idle game :)
channel.description:
Took me about a month to make:
www.diamondhunt.co
Have fun :) ! Working on mmo now

item.title: My addictive idle game :)
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:38, topic:545114”][quote author=Elrick link=topic=663996.msg4441697#msg4441697 date=1406864327]
Hit Silver Division, but now I feel like I have no reason to play it. Honestly, odds are those ever started being updated again I might look at donating, but not in this state.
[/quote]
Same, once I hit silver division I quit playing[/quote]
Decided to play it a bit more, I ended up with way too much money. I ended up getting stuck on waiting for bars. Really wish there was more upgrades in terms of herb gathering and furnace speed.

The divisions idea is excellent, but I would have like to see the check list stay there once you obtained it. I didn’t realize the check would disappear if I went under 1m wood.[/quote]especially with the money part.

item.title: My addictive idle game :)
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:25, topic:545114”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=663996.msg4441029#msg4441029 date=1406644147]

[quote author=whattehp406 link=topic=663996.msg4441025#msg4441025 date=1406643656]

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=663996.msg4440997#msg4440997 date=1406627157]

auto clicker at 1 milli second as much cheating as I do

[/quote]speaking of this, left my autoclicker on for my whole 8 hour shift, came back and was not displeased xD
[/quote]I had this running on my tablet, turned down the brightness to lowest and plugged it in. It uses so much power i woke up to an extremely hot tablet with a 5% battery

How can a web thing use so much power.

I believe if you left any program running all night like that, you’d wake up to the same conditions. Tablets are not computers, they’re not made to be left on for extended periods like that. and what you just did, have fun with your battery.
[/quote]Not always, i’be done it before with something else and i woke up to a hot but fully charged tablet.

Yeah, waking up with it being “hot” is bad. You’re stressing the hell out of the battery, and it’s lifespan will drain so much faster that way.
Overcharging is bad for it as well. I actually have a laptop I have to basically keep plugged in 24/7 because of it being overcharged and things like that, causing the battery to only have about 1 maybe 2 hours of life compared to about 12 (continuous) when I first got it.

I won’t try and stop you from doing it, but that’s seriously bad for the battery, and the components in the tablet itself.

im pretty sure unless you’ve got a fudgeing old battery overcharging is 99999 better than letting it run to almost empty before recharging, iirc thats how it works with newer battery technology[/quote]It is actually. With Li-ion or similar you schould keep it from getting too low as that damages it.

Read full topic

[/quote]I had this running on my tablet, turned down the brightness to lowest and plugged it in. It uses so much power i woke up to an extremely hot tablet with a 5% battery

How can a web thing use so much power.

I believe if you left any program running all night like that, you’d wake up to the same conditions. Tablets are not computers, they’re not made to be left on for extended periods like that. and what you just did, have fun with your battery.
[/quote]Not always, i’be done it before with something else and i woke up to a hot but fully charged tablet.

Yeah, waking up with it being “hot” is bad. You’re stressing the hell out of the battery, and it’s lifespan will drain so much faster that way.
Overcharging is bad for it as well. I actually have a laptop I have to basically keep plugged in 24/7 because of it being overcharged and things like that, causing the battery to only have about 1 maybe 2 hours of life compared to about 12 (continuous) when I first got it.

I won’t try and stop you from doing it, but that’s seriously bad for the battery, and the components in the tablet itself.[/quote]
im pretty sure unless you’ve got a fucking old battery overcharging is 99999 better than letting it run to almost empty before recharging, iirc thats how it works with newer battery technology

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:23, topic:545114”][quote author=whattehp406 link=topic=663996.msg4441025#msg4441025 date=1406643656]

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=663996.msg4440997#msg4440997 date=1406627157]

[quote author=whattehp406 link=topic=663996.msg4440996#msg4440996 date=1406626432]

auto clicker at 1 milli second as much cheating as I do

[/quote]speaking of this, left my autoclicker on for my whole 8 hour shift, came back and was not displeased xD
[/quote]I had this running on my tablet, turned down the brightness to lowest and plugged it in. It uses so much power i woke up to an extremely hot tablet with a 5% battery

How can a web thing use so much power.

I believe if you left any program running all night like that, you’d wake up to the same conditions. Tablets are not computers, they’re not made to be left on for extended periods like that. and what you just did, have fun with your battery.
[/quote]Not always, i’be done it before with something else and i woke up to a hot but fully charged tablet.

Yeah, waking up with it being “hot” is bad. You’re stressing the hell out of the battery, and it’s lifespan will drain so much faster that way.
Overcharging is bad for it as well. I actually have a laptop I have to basically keep plugged in 24/7 because of it being overcharged and things like that, causing the battery to only have about 1 maybe 2 hours of life compared to about 12 (continuous) when I first got it.

I won’t try and stop you from doing it, but that’s seriously bad for the battery, and the components in the tablet itself.[/quote]yeah, with my phone I try to make it go down to 10% before I plug it in, just to make the battery last longer but you can tell when it starts to kill itself quicker.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“whattehp406, post:22, topic:545114”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=663996.msg4440997#msg4440997 date=1406627157]

[quote author=whattehp406 link=topic=663996.msg4440996#msg4440996 date=1406626432]

[quote author=ox random xi link=topic=663996.msg4440815#msg4440815 date=1406585083]

auto clicker at 1 milli second as much cheating as I do

[/quote]speaking of this, left my autoclicker on for my whole 8 hour shift, came back and was not displeased xD
[/quote]I had this running on my tablet, turned down the brightness to lowest and plugged it in. It uses so much power i woke up to an extremely hot tablet with a 5% battery

How can a web thing use so much power.

I believe if you left any program running all night like that, you’d wake up to the same conditions. Tablets are not computers, they’re not made to be left on for extended periods like that. and what you just did, have fun with your battery.
[/quote]Not always, i’be done it before with something else and i woke up to a hot but fully charged tablet.[/quote]
Yeah, waking up with it being “hot” is bad. You’re stressing the hell out of the battery, and it’s lifespan will drain so much faster that way.
Overcharging is bad for it as well. I actually have a laptop I have to basically keep plugged in 24/7 because of it being overcharged and things like that, causing the battery to only have about 1 maybe 2 hours of life compared to about 12 (continuous) when I first got it.

I won’t try and stop you from doing it, but that’s seriously bad for the battery, and the components in the tablet itself.

item.title: My addictive idle game :)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:12, topic:545114”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=663996.msg4440336#msg4440336 date=1406415399]

Quite awesome

Invest in woodcutters as soon as possible for massive income boost

I’d rather invest in the power of JavaScript.

Or… even.

for(i = 0; i < 1000; i++) { applyMining(this);// Mines the big rock }
[/quote]
What’s the point in playing this way?[/quote]
I don’t feel like wasting that much time playing a javascript game in the first place. Sure, they can be fun. But 9/10 of them are this. An idle game.
That’s really repetitive. And boring.
So, I do this and see if there’s anything really different to it. And as always, not really.

Sorry mate. Just not my style of game (to OP). It was fun around the time when cookie clicker first came out, then everyone did their spin on it 1000 times over and killed it.

Read full topic
